author.name: J.D. Salinger
author.biography: Jerome David Salinger was an American writer known for his widely-read novel, 'The Catcher in the Rye.' He led a private life and was known for his aversion to publicity.

author.name: Harper Lee
author.biography: Harper Lee was an American novelist best known for her Pulitzer Prize-winning novel 'To Kill a Mockingbird.' She was known for her reclusive lifestyle.

author.name: George Orwell
author.biography: George Orwell, the pen name of Eric Arthur Blair, was an English novelist and essayist. He is best known for his dystopian novel '1984' and the allegorical novella 'Animal Farm.'

author.name: F. Scott Fitzgerald
author.biography: Francis Scott Key Fitzgerald was an American novelist and short story writer, widely regarded as one of the greatest American writers of the 20th century. He is best known for his novel 'The Great Gatsby.'

author.name: Jane Austen
author.biography: Jane Austen was an English novelist known for her six major novels, including 'Pride and Prejudice.' Her works are considered classics of English literature.

author.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
author.biography: John Ronald Reuel Tolkien was an English writer, poet, philologist, and academic. He is best known for his high-fantasy works 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings.'

books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone

author.name: J.K. Rowling
author.biography: Joanne Rowling, known by her pen name J.K. Rowling, is a British author, philanthropist, and film producer. She is best known for the 'Harry Potter' series.

author.name: J.R.R. Tolkien
author.biography: John Ronald Reuel Tolkien was an English writer, poet, philologist, and academic. He is best known for his high-fantasy works 'The Hobbit' and 'The Lord of the Rings.'

author.name: Suzanne Collins
author.biography: Suzanne Collins is an American television writer and novelist, best known as the author of 'The Hunger Games' trilogy.

author.name: Dan Brown
author.biography: Dan Brown is an American author known for his bestselling novels, including 'The Da Vinci Code' and 'Angels & Demons.'

author.name: Stephen King
author.biography: Stephen King is an American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, and fantasy novels. He is one of the most prolific and widely read authors in the world.

author.name: Aldous Huxley
author.biography: Aldous Huxley was an English writer and philosopher. He is best known for his dystopian novel 'Brave New World' and his essays.

author.name: C.S. Lewis
author.biography: Clive Staples Lewis was a British writer and scholar. He is best known for 'The Chronicles of Narnia,' a classic series of seven fantasy novels.

author.name: Gabriel García Márquez
author.biography: Gabriel García Márquez was a Colombian novelist and Nobel Prize winner. He is best known for his magical realist novel 'One Hundred Years of Solitude.'

books.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

author.name: Douglas Adams
author.biography: Douglas Adams was an English author, scriptwriter, essayist, humorist, satirist, and dramatist. He is best known for 'The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy' series.

books.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

author.name: Stieg Larsson
author.biography: Stieg Larsson was a Swedish journalist and writer. He is best known for the 'Millennium' series, including 'The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo.'

author.name: George R.R. Martin
author.biography: George Raymond Richard Martin, often referred to as GRRM, is an American novelist and short story writer. He is best known for his epic fantasy series 'A Song of Ice and Fire.'

author.name: Paulo Coelho
author.biography: Paulo Coelho is a Brazilian lyricist and novelist. He is best known for his novel 'The Alchemist,' which has been translated into 80 languages.

author.name: Cormac McCarthy
author.biography: Cormac McCarthy is an American novelist, playwright, and screenwriter. He is best known for his novel 'The Road,' which won the Pulitzer Prize for Fiction.

author.name: John Green
author.biography: John Green is an American author and YouTube content creator. He is best known for his novel 'The Fault in Our Stars,' which explores themes of love and mortality.

author.name: Khaled Hosseini
author.biography: Khaled Hosseini is an Afghan-American novelist and physician. He gained international acclaim for his debut novel 'The Kite Runner.'

author.name: Stephen King
author.biography: Stephen King is an American author of horror, supernatural fiction, suspense, and fantasy novels. 'The Stand' is one of his acclaimed works.

author.name: Margaret Atwood
author.biography: Margaret Atwood is a Canadian poet, novelist, literary critic, essayist, and environmental activist. 'The Handmaid's Tale' is a dystopian masterpiece.

author.name: Kurt Vonnegut
author.biography: Kurt Vonnegut was an American writer known for his satirical novels. 'Slaughterhouse-Five' is a blend of science fiction and anti-war themes.

author.name: Joseph Heller
author.biography: Joseph Heller was an American author of novels, short stories, plays, and screenplays. 'Catch-22' is a classic satirical novel.

author.name: Mary Shelley
author.biography: Mary Shelley was an English novelist. 'Frankenstein' is her most famous work, often considered the first science fiction novel.

author.name: Emily Brontë
author.biography: Emily Brontë was an English novelist and poet. 'Wuthering Heights' is her only novel and a classic of English literature.

author.name: Oscar Wilde
author.biography: Oscar Wilde was an Irish poet and playwright. 'The Picture of Dorian Gray' is a philosophical novel about the consequences of indulgence.

author.name: Bram Stoker
author.biography: Bram Stoker was an Irish author and theater manager. 'Dracula' is a Gothic horror novel that has become a classic of the vampire genre.

books.title: The Road Not Taken and Other Poems

author.name: Robert Frost
author.biography: Robert Frost was an American poet. His collection 'The Road Not Taken and Other Poems' is celebrated for its evocative exploration of nature and choice.

author.name: Andy Weir
author.biography: Andy Weir is an American novelist. 'The Martian' is a science fiction novel known for its accurate portrayal of scientific concepts and survival on Mars.

author.name: Alice Walker
author.biography: Alice Walker is an American novelist and poet. 'The Color Purple' is a Pulitzer Prize-winning novel that explores African-American women's experiences.

author.name: John Steinbeck
author.biography: John Steinbeck was an American author. 'The Grapes of Wrath' is a classic novel depicting the struggles of a family during the Great Depression.

author.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
author.biography: Fyodor Dostoevsky was a Russian novelist, philosopher, and essayist. 'The Brothers Karamazov' is one of his masterpieces.

books.title: One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest

author.name: Ken Kesey
author.biography: Ken Kesey was an American novelist, best known for his novel 'One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest,' which explores themes of sanity and rebellion.

books.title: The Old Man and the Sea

author.name: Ernest Hemingway
author.biography: Ernest Hemingway was an American novelist and short story writer. 'The Old Man and the Sea' is a classic novella about an aging Cuban fisherman.

author.name: Fyodor Dostoevsky
author.biography: Fyodor Dostoevsky was a Russian novelist, philosopher, and essayist. 'Crime and Punishment' is a psychological novel exploring morality and guilt.

author.name: Charles Dickens
author.biography: Charles Dickens was an English writer and social critic. 'Great Expectations' is a coming-of-age novel set in Victorian England.

author.name: William Faulkner
author.biography: William Faulkner was an American writer. 'The Sound and the Fury' is a Southern Gothic novel known for its complex narrative structure.

author.name: Herman Melville
author.biography: Herman Melville was an American novelist and poet. 'Moby-Dick' is a maritime adventure novel exploring themes of obsession and revenge.

author.name: Homer
author.biography: Homer is an ancient Greek poet traditionally said to be the author of the epic poems 'The Iliad' and 'The Odyssey.'

author.name: Victor Hugo
author.biography: Victor Hugo was a French poet, novelist, and dramatist. 'Les Misérables' is a historical novel known for its portrayal of social injustice.

author.name: Alexandre Dumas
author.biography: Alexandre Dumas was a French writer known for his historical novels. 'The Count of Monte Cristo' is a tale of revenge and redemption.

author.name: Ernest Hemingway
author.biography: Ernest Hemingway was an American novelist and short story writer. 'For Whom the Bell Tolls' is a war novel set during the Spanish Civil War.

author.name: Ernest Hemingway
author.biography: Ernest Hemingway was an American novelist and short story writer. 'The Sun Also Rises' is a novel that captures the disillusionment of the Lost Generation.

author.name: Upton Sinclair
author.biography: Upton Sinclair was an American writer and socialist. 'The Jungle' is a novel exposing the harsh conditions of the meatpacking industry.

author.name: Dante Alighieri
author.biography: Dante Alighieri was an Italian poet. 'The Divine Comedy' is an epic poem describing the journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

author.name: Nathaniel Hawthorne
author.biography: Nathaniel Hawthorne was an American novelist. 'The Scarlet Letter' explores the consequences of adultery in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts.

author.name: H.G. Wells
author.biography: H.G. Wells was an English writer. 'The War of the Worlds' is a science fiction novel depicting an alien invasion of Earth.
